## Brief description

::: {.cell}

:::

::: {.cell}

:::

These very large rivers transport massive volumes of freshwater (>10,000m<sup>3</sup>/s) through flat lowlands, mostly in tropical or subtropical regions. Their very large flow volumes, diverse habitats and slow to moderate flows make them highly productive. High nutrient levels come from upstream catchments and floodplains, with additional productivity contributed by in-channel algae and aquatic plants. Their food webs are complex, with a high diversity of plants and animals, including large-bodied fish, reptiles and mammals.

Read more about this functional group at: <https://global-ecosystems.org/explore/groups/F1.7>{target="webapp"}

## Map description
***F1.7 Large lowland rivers***

The distribution of large lowland rivers was taken from the Global River Classification database (Ouellet Dallaire et al. 2018). Reaches with flow > 10,000 m3/s were mapped with a 20 km buffer as major occurrences, clipped to exclude those with seasonal freezing temperatures (mean temperature of coldest quarter <0Â°C)..

 **Map code and version**: F1.7.web.orig v2.0. **GIS data (raster and vector format) available at** DOI:[10.5281/zenodo.5090974](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090974)
